Northwest Arkansas Healthcare Partnership Hub

Restoring Hope Clinic serves as the central coordination hub connecting patients with a comprehensive network of healthcare providers across Northwest Arkansas. Our revolutionary partnership model eliminates healthcare fragmentation by creating seamless pathways between clinics, specialists, and community health organizations, ensuring every patient receives coordinated, comprehensive care.

Partnership Hub

Connecting healthcare providers across Northwest Arkansas

Coordinated Care

Seamless referrals and comprehensive care pathways

Accessibility

Free healthcare for uninsured and underinsured patients

Innovation

Revolutionary partnership model for sustainable healthcare

Our Launch Timeline

We're building this revolutionary healthcare model in carefully planned phases, starting with our August 2025 launch at 7Hills Homeless Center in Fayetteville.

Opening date

Comprehensive Services at 7Hills

Our integrated approach addresses healthcare and housing together, providing a full spectrum of services to break the cycle of homelessness and support sustainable solutions.

Medical Care

General health screenings, chronic disease management, preventive care, and skin cancer screenings with student doctors and physician mentors.

Learn About Medical Services

Mental Health & Dental

Comprehensive mental health services, therapy, medication management, and full dental care including cleanings and treatments.

Explore Health Services

Transitional Housing

Supportive housing services through our partnership with 7Hills, helping patients transition from homelessness to stable housing.

Housing Support Info

Student Training

Medical students from UAMS, WRMC, and Alice Walton School gain hands-on experience while providing supervised care.

Join as Student

Job Training & Support

Employment assistance, job training programs, and connections with local employers to support workforce reintegration.

Employment Services

Clinic Partnership Network

Join our growing network of healthcare providers! We serve as a central hub connecting patients with local clinics, specialists, and healthcare services across Northwest Arkansas.

Partner With Us

Breaking Cycles, Building Futures

We're not just treating symptoms—we're addressing root causes. By integrating healthcare with housing, job training, and community support, we're creating pathways to lasting stability and hope.

Holistic Approach

Addressing medical, mental health, housing, and employment needs together

Educational Excellence

Training compassionate healthcare leaders while serving the community

Scalable Model

Creating a replicable blueprint for other communities facing similar challenges

Frequently Asked Questions

Everything You Need to Know

Get answers to common questions about our services, launch timeline, and how to get involved with Restoring Hope Clinic.

We coordinate care between dozens of healthcare providers across Northwest Arkansas. Our hub model connects patients with the right specialists, manages referrals, and ensures comprehensive care pathways from primary care through specialty services.

Healthcare providers, clinics, and specialists can join our partnership network by visiting our Partner page and completing the partnership application. We work with all types of healthcare providers to create seamless referral pathways.

We primarily serve uninsured and underinsured individuals in Northwest Arkansas. Our partnership hub ensures that patients receive appropriate care regardless of their ability to pay, connecting them with the right providers in our network.

Through our partnership network, we coordinate comprehensive medical, dental, and mental health services. While we provide direct care at 7Hills, we also connect patients with specialists and services throughout our partner network.

We are launching in August 2025 at 7Hills Homeless Center in Fayetteville, Arkansas. We're actively building our partnership network now to ensure comprehensive care coordination from day one.

We offer volunteer opportunities for medical students, healthcare professionals, and community members. Visit our Volunteer page to learn about current opportunities and apply to join our team.

Still have questions?

We're here to help! Contact us directly and we'll be happy to provide more information about our services, volunteer opportunities, or partnership possibilities.

Call (870) 335-6746Send us an email
